page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: { There are three little hamlets in this block, Trenance, Porthoustock and Rosenithon. Porthoustock has three 'Coast Guard Cottages' which used to be a Coast Guard station and housed the Coast Guard and his family. They are now council houses. There is still a Coast Guard lookout post. The MOD have an observation post at Porthkerris point as well as a radar station half a mile inland. This is out of bounds to the public with an electric fence and radiation warning signs. There is one food and ice-cream shop at Porthoustock. Most houses are now owner occupied though they were originally built for quarrymen and fishermen. These hamlets are particularly quaint having beautiful gardens with some thatched roofed cottages.
